item.description:
TC; David - DGoldsmith38@aol.com (978) 740-0345 before 9:30

EVENT: A chance to harvest your own crop of apples at a local farm in Peabody. We plan to meet for a picnic lunch and then at 12:45 head into an orchard that will be filled with a crisp McIntosh, Cortland, Empire, Gala, and Red Delicious apples that are great and edible right off the tree. The Farm has a picnic area, the orchard, walking trails and even a possible hayride.
MEET: 12 PM at the Farms’ picnic area in Peabody (Look for a Mosaic’s sign) and bring some lunch, as we will have a little picnic before going out into orchard. Brooksby has some hiking trails if anyone wants to come early to explore. Rain cancels
RSVP: By Sept 26th and include email address and phone number in case of cancellation
Cost: For any apples you take home Figure around $21 for 1/2 Bushel, $8 for a package of 16 and $5.00 for nonmembers
For directions check:
Brooksby Farm
38 Felton Street
Peabody, MA 01960
Phone: (978) 531-7546
www.essexheritage.org/sites/brooksby_farm.shtml
item.how_to_find_us: Contact the TC and then look for him at the picnic area with a Mosaic cap.

group.name: Mosaic Jewish Outdoor Club of Massachusetts

item.name: APPLE PICKING IN PEABODY at Brooksby Farms
